title: Frontend Developer
job_description:
Location: Ahmedabad (On-site only)

Experience: 1–3 Years

Company: iMobile Designs Pvt. Ltd.

Type: Full-time


At iMobile Designs Pvt. Ltd., we’re more than just an app development company — we’re a bunch of tech enthusiasts who love turning smart ideas into seamless digital products. Based in Ahmedabad, we work with clients across healthcare, e-commerce, and SaaS to build apps that are fast, user-friendly, and actually useful.




We’re growing, and we’re looking for someone who’s just as passionate about clean code and great design as we are.


Your Responsibilities:

Build and maintain mobile apps using Flutter & Dart
Turn beautiful UI/UX designs (from Figma or XD) into working code
Collaborate with backend developers to connect APIs and services
Test, debug, and make sure the app performs well across devices
Keep your code clean, readable, and well-structured
Bring in your own ideas to improve the user experience




Requirements:

1–3 years of experience working with Flutter
A solid understanding of how mobile UIs work
Experience with REST APIs, Firebase, and version control (Git)
Comfort with state management tools like Provider, Riverpod, or Bloc
Bonus points if you’ve published apps or know native Android/iOS
A team player who communicates clearly and loves learning




Perks of working with us:

A supportive, friendly team that values your input
Real projects for real clients — no fake tasks here
Plenty of space to grow, experiment, and upskill
A workplace where you’re seen as a person, not a resource




How to apply:

If this sounds like a good fit, we’d love to hear from you!
Send your resume (and any app links or GitHub profiles) to hr@imobiledesigns.com

﻿Subject: Flutter Developer Application

title: Full Stack Developer (Node.js)
job_description:
Company Description


Established in 2013, Supportsoft Technologies is committed to transforming businesses through technology and excellence. Initially starting with just an investment of AUD 2K and 5 seats, the company has grown into a thriving enterprise with over 40 employees. Our mission is to empower small and medium businesses by offering virtual staffing solutions, reducing in-house payroll and rental costs. We specialize in custom software development, mobile app development, web development, and digital marketing. We serve clients across various industries including IT & Technology, Hospitality & Tourism, Finance & Banking, Manufacturing, Real Estate, and E-commerce & Retail.


Role Description


This is a full-time on-site role for a Full Stack Developer (Node.js) located in Jaipur. The Full Stack Developer will be responsible for developing and maintaining web applications, creating and implementing front-end and back-end components, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality software solutions. The developer will also be required to ensure the application of best practices in coding, testing, and deployment processes.


Qualifications

Proficiency in Back-End Web Development and Full-Stack Development
Experience with Front-End Development, including HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Skilled in Software Development and proficient in Node.js
Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) expertise
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in a collaborative environment
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field
Experience in the technology industry is a plus

title: Full Stack Developer - NestJS + React.js
job_description:
Company Description

At SenneS Technology Solutions Pvt Ltd, we specialize in building AI-powered products that solve real-world problems and drive digital transformation. Our mission is to transform ideas into smart, scalable AI solutions that deliver impact. We offer services in custom AI product development, predictive modeling and data analysis, computer vision and NLP solutions, and end-to-end AI integration. With a team of passionate developers, data scientists, and innovators, we focus on building intelligent, intuitive, ethical AI systems ready for the future.




Role Description

This is a full-time on-site role for a Full Stack Developer specializing in NestJS and React.js at our Chennai location. The Full Stack Developer will be responsible for developing and maintaining both back-end and front-end applications. Day-to-day tasks include designing and implementing APIs, ensuring application performance, collaborating with cross-functional teams, debugging and troubleshooting code, and continuously enhancing the user experience through innovative solutions.




Key Responsibilities:Develop and maintain server-side applications using NestJS framework.

Design RESTful APIs and ensure security, performance, and scalability.
Build responsive and dynamic user interfaces with React.js.
Collaborate with designers and other developers to deliver high-quality features.
Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code.
Integrate third-party APIs and services as required.
Participate in code reviews and ensure adherence to best practices.
Debug and resolve technical issues across the stack.
Optimize application performance on both frontend and backend.




Required Skills & Qualifications:

2+ years of experience with Node.js, and at least 1 year with NestJS.
Strong proficiency in JavaScript and TypeScript.
Solid understanding of React.js, hooks, and component-based architecture.
Experience with RESTful APIs, JWT, and middleware handling.
Familiarity with PostgreSQL, MongoDB, or other databases.
Knowledge of frontend tools such as Webpack, Babel, ESLint, etc.
Experience with version control (Git) and CI/CD workflows.
Understanding of software development principles (SOLID, DRY, etc.).
Ability to write unit and integration tests (e.g., Jest, Supertest, React Testing Library).

Good to Have:

Experience with GraphQL.
Familiarity with containerization (Docker).
Cloud deployment experience (AWS/GCP/Azure).
Basic understanding of UI/UX principles.




Education:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field (or equivalent practical experience).

title: Web Developer (Wordpress)
company_name: Know All Edge Networks Pvt Ltd
job_description:
Hiring for Web Developer (Wordpress) for Malad, Mumbai @ Know All Edge Networks Pvt Ltd




Position: Web Developer (Wordpress)

Employment: Full time

Experience: 2+years

Job location: Malad, Mumbai




Role Summary:

We're looking for a technically strong web developer who can build, manage, and optimize websites with an eye on SEO, user experience, and performance. A deep understanding of technical SEO and Core Web Vitals is a must.




Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain company websites (WordPress or other CMS)
Ensure websites are fast, responsive, and technically SEO-optimized
Implement Core Web Vitals best practices (LCP, FID, CLS)
Handle domain, hosting, CDN, and caching solutions
Collaborate with SEO, content, and design teams to support digital campaigns




Requirements:

Strong skills in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and WordPress/other CMS
Experience optimizing Core Web Vitals
Familiarity with schema markup, sitemaps, robots.txt, etc.
Basic knowledge of SEO and analytics tools

title: Machine Learning Engineer (T25)
job_description:
At eBay, we're more than a global ecommerce leader — we’re changing the way the world shops and sells. Our platform empowers millions of buyers and sellers in more than 190 markets around the world. We’re committed to pushing boundaries and leaving our mark as we reinvent the future of ecommerce for enthusiasts.

Our customers are our compass, authenticity thrives, bold ideas are welcome, and everyone can bring their unique selves to work — every day. We're in this together, sustaining the future of our customers, our company, and our planet.

Join a team of passionate thinkers, innovators, and dreamers — and help us connect people and build communities to create economic opportunity for all.

Machine Learning Engineer (T25), Product Knowledge

Do you love Big Data? Deploying Machine Learning models? Challenging optimization problems? Knowledgeable, collaborative co-workers? Come work at eBay and help us redefine global, online commerce!

Who Are We?

The Product Knowledge team is at the epicenter of eBay’s Tech-driven, Customer-centric overhaul. Our team is entrusted with creating and using eBay’s Product Knowledge - a vast Big Data system which is built up of listings, transactions, products, knowledge graphs, and more. Our team has a mix of highly proficient people from multiple fields such as Machine Learning, Data Science, Software Engineering, Operations, and Big Data Analytics. We have a strong culture of collaboration, and plenty of opportunity to learn, make an impact, and grow!

What Will You Do

We Are Looking For Exceptional Engineers, Who Take Pride In Creating Simple Solutions To Apparently-complex Problems. Our Engineering Tasks Typically Involve At Least One Of The Following


Building a pipeline that processes up to billions of items, frequently employing ML models on these datasets
Creating services that provide Search or other Information Retrieval capabilities at low latency on datasets of hundreds of millions of items
Crafting sound API design and driving integration between our Data layers and Customer-facing applications and components
Designing and running A/B tests in Production experiences in order to vet and measure the impact of any new or improved functionality



If you love a good challenge, and are good at handling complexity - we’d love to hear from you!

eBay is an amazing company to work for. Being on the team, you can expect to benefit from:


A competitive salary - including stock grants and a yearly bonus
A healthy work culture that promotes business impact and at the same time highly values your personal well-being
Being part of a force for good in this world - eBay truly cares about its employees, its customers, and the world’s population, and takes every opportunity to make this clearly apparent



Job Responsibilities


Design, deliver, and maintain significant features in data pipelines, ML processing, and / or service infrastructure
Optimize software performance to achieve the required throughput and / or latency
Work with your manager, peers, and Product Managers to scope projects and features
Come up with a sound technical strategy, taking into consideration the project goals, timelines, and expected impact
Take point on some cross-team efforts, taking ownership of a business problem and ensuring the different teams are in sync and working towards a coherent technical solution
Take active part in knowledge sharing across the organization - both teaching and learning from others



Minimum Qualifications


Passion and commitment for technical excellence
B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Computer Science or an equivalent professional experience
2+ years of software design and development experience, tackling non-trivial problems in backend services and / or data pipelines
A solid foundation in Data Structures, Algorithms, Object-Oriented Programming, Software Design, and core Statistics knowledge
Experience in production-grade coding in Java, and Python/Scala
Experience in the close examination of data and computation of statistics
Experience in using and operating Big Data processing pipelines, such as: Hadoop and Spark
Good verbal and written communication and collaboration skills



Please see the Talent Privacy Notice for information regarding how eBay handles your personal data collected when you use the eBay Careers website or apply for a job with eBay.

eBay is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you have a need that requires accommodation, please contact us at talent@ebay.com. We will make every effort to respond to your request for accommodation as soon as possible. View our accessibility statement to learn more about eBay's commitment to ensuring digital accessibility for people with disabilities.

The eBay Jobs website uses cookies to enhance your experience. By continuing to browse the site, you agree to our use of cookies. Visit our Privacy Center for more information.

title: Software Engineer Intern
job_description:
Therra is a new kind of supplement marketplace — one built on transparency, testing, and trust.

We’re solving a massive problem in the health & wellness industry: no one knows what’s actually inside the supplements they buy. From protein powders to sleep gummies, the market is full of mislabeled, under-tested, and overhyped products.




Responsibilities

We’re looking for a smart, driven generalist who wants to build zero-to-one with us. You'll work directly with the founder and play a cross-functional role across product, community, and growth.




Qualifications

You’re obsessed with health, wellness, or biohacking

You think like a founder — take initiative, own outcomes, ship fast




Strong proficiency in React.js (functional components, hooks, context API)
Solid understanding of HTML5, CSS3, and modern JS (ES6+)
Experience building responsive, mobile-first UIs (Flexbox, Grid)
Familiar with state management libraries (Redux, Zustand, Recoil, or Context)
Confident working with APIs (REST, GraphQL)
Git proficiency and familiarity with GitHub workflows




Bonus: You've worked on marketplaces, community products, or consumer tech

Extra bonus: You’ve experimented with your own stack, followed Andrew Huberman, or tracked your own biomarkers 😉

title: Python Developer
job_description:
Role Description

The Python Developer will be responsible for back-end web development, software development, and object-oriented programming. The daily tasks will include creating and maintaining databases, writing and optimizing code, and collaborating with other team members to ensure the efficiency and performance of the software.




Qualifications

\n
Proficiency in Back-End Web Development and Software Development

Experience with Databases
Excellent problem-solving and analytical abilities
Ability to work independently and remotely
Experience in Agile development practices is a plus

title: Product Engineer - AI/ML
job_description:
Location: Hyderabad, India (Hybrid or In-office)

Type: Full-time

Experience: 2–5 years (Exceptional freshers or self-taught candidates welcome)

Team: Product Engineering – AI/ML

🧠 About the Role

We're building a 10X team at the intersection of AI, product, and education. As an AI/ML Product Engineer, you’ll go beyond theory—shipping real products that impact millions. If you’re obsessed with LLMs, can build and break fast, and thrive in a builder-led, product-driven environment, we want you.

✅ What You’ll Do
Build and deploy AI/ML-powered tools and features using LLMs, LangChain, RAG pipelines, and vector databases
Rapidly prototype and ship minimum viable products (MVPs) within weeks
Collaborate with product designers to create intuitive, impactful user experiences
Work closely with platform teams to integrate AI into products like Certs365 and Proctoring365
Debug and improve user flows with a fixer-first mindset
Think in systems — map out how various parts of the product fit together for scale
Contribute to a mission-first culture, solving real problems in skilling, certification, and lifelong learning
🔍 What We’re Looking For1. AI/ML Proficiency

Hands-on with LLMs, LangChain, Pinecone/FAISS, RAG, OpenAI APIs, etc.

2. Builder Mindset

You've shipped live products, tools, or demos—fast. (Think Replit, Product Hunt, or your own portfolio.)

3. Product Thinking

You care about UX, not just models. You've redesigned flows or debugged frustrating interfaces.

4. Fixer Mentality

You love squashing bugs and improving user experiences—even when no one asks.

5. Systems Thinking

You see how everything connects: APIs, DBs, frontend, backend, and users.

6. Mission-Driven Approach

You want to build meaningful AI solutions in education, skilling, or social impact—not just cool tech.

7. Communication Skills

You can clearly explain decisions in docs, demos, or during standups.

📎 Bonus Points For
Contributions to open-source AI tools
Prior experience in edtech, skilling platforms, or learning ecosystems
GitHub, Product Hunt, Kaggle, or public portfolios
Hyderabad-based but open to hybrid flexibility
🎯 Why Join Us?
Work with a mission-driven, 10X team
Solve real-world problems with AI, at scale
Build products used by thousands (soon millions) in the learning space
Autonomy, velocity, and ownership from Day 1

title: Software Engineer (LLM Applications & AI Tools)
job_description:
🧑‍💻 Job Title




Software Engineer (LLM Applications & AI Tools)




🏢 Company




PiHex Labs

🌐 Website | LinkedIn

📍 Remote | 🕒 Full-Time / Internship




🧩 About PiHex Labs




PiHex Labs is a modern tech firm focused on AI, software engineering, and scalable backend systems. We work with global clients to create robust, high-performance platforms that are secure, efficient, and reliable.




🚀 Role Overview




We are looking for a Software Engineer with experience in LLM-based applications to join our team. This role involves building AI-powered tools, designing structured data pipelines with LLMs, and working on innovative applications that combine backend systems with intelligent front-end interfaces.

You'll get to work on prompt engineering, structured data generation (JSON, APIs), and seamless integration of LLMs into real-world applications.




🛠️ Responsibilities




Design and build LLM-based applications and pipelines for structured data generation and processing
Develop prompt-engineering strategies to improve the accuracy and reliability of LLM outputs
Work on backend integrations, APIs, and cloud-based deployments for AI-driven tools
Implement best practices for scalable and efficient AI applications
Collaborate on developing interactive front-end interfaces (React/Next.js) that integrate with AI-powered backends
Write clean, maintainable, and well-tested code, participate in code reviews, and follow agile workflows




✅ Requirements




Strong experience in Python (FastAPI, Flask, or Django)
Familiarity with LLM APIs (OpenAI, Anthropic, etc.) and prompt engineering
Good understanding of structured data formats (JSON, YAML) and API design
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS/GCP/Azure) and containerization (Docker)
Strong debugging skills and the ability to work with complex data pipelines
Solid understanding of Git workflows and collaborative software development




🌟 Nice to Have




Experience with LangChain, Instructor, or similar LLM frameworks
Exposure to front-end frameworks (React, Next.js) for building AI-powered interfaces
Knowledge of data transformation tools and scientific data formats (JSON-LD, etc.)
Familiarity with DevOps practices and CI/CD pipelines




🎁 Perks

💰 Fair Stipend or Salary Based on Skills and Experience
🕓 Flexible Work Hours
📍 Remote-Friendly Setup
📈 Learning & Growth Opportunities
👥 Collaborative Team Culture

﻿

📬 How to Apply

Submit your application using this Google Form.

title: Software Engineer (C#/.Net, Angular or React)
job_description:
Job Description

Expect more. Connect more. Be more at Diebold Nixdorf. Our teams automate, digitize, and transform the way more than 75 million people around the globe bank and shop in this hyper-connected, consumer-centric world. Join us in connecting people to commerce in this vital, rewarding role.

Applies the principles of software engineering to the design, development, maintenance, testing and evaluation of software and computer systems. Works cross-functionally to understand business requirements, evaluate alternative approaches and ensure software and systems are designed to facilitate ease of use and seamless integration into the target environments. Incorporates state-of-the-art concepts, tools and practices to facilitate system functionality, security and continuous improvement.

Responsibilities


Provides Software Engineering for an assigned set of system elements.
Designs, codes, tests and documents basic and moderately complex components according to standard protocols and coding guidelines.
Provides technical support and troubleshooting for new and existing systems, making recommendations for their improvement.
Participates in discussions about feature development and related project estimation and resource planning.
Follows secure coding practices and aligned testing requirements.
Writes automated unit and system tests to provide coverage for common code paths.
Gains comfort working in and contributing ideas to a development team.
Notifies team or technical manager of variances from plans and identifies changes in scope or work.
Builds working relationships with cross-functional engineers and teams, striving to learn and gain broader technical understanding.



Qualifications


Required Qualifications


At least 2+ years of hands-on experience implementing solutions for integration of on-premises and/or cloud systems.
Experience with full software development life cycle, continuous integration, unit testing, and version control
Degree in Computer Science, IT, Computer Engineering, MIS, Mathematics, or related field (MBA or MS degree preferred)
Strong written and verbal communication.
Must have the ability to communicate technical components with clarity and ability to operate in a fast-paced environment with evolving project requirements and priorities.
Experience in working in cross-functional, cross-geography product/content development setup.
Experience with full software development life cycle, continuous integration, unit testing, and version control.
Good communicative and written English
Master or Bachelor in IT systems, computer systems or related.



Must Have :


HTML5/XML/CSS
Angular (at least Angular2) or React
C# / .NET Core,
MS SQL, Couch DB/No SQL,
REST



Nice to have:


Node.JS, Kendo UI or any other UI component library
Windows Controls, TypeScript
Couch DB/No SQL
React JSAzure SQL
Docker, Redis, Azure Exposure,
RabbitMQ
Jenkins
Kubernetes
Exposure on SSO/OAuth/OIDC



About Us

Why should you join Diebold Nixdorf?

Brightest minds + technology and innovation + business transformation The people of Diebold Nixdorf are 23,000+ teammates of diverse talents and expertise in more than 130 countries, harnessing future technologies to deliver personalized, secure consumer experiences that connect people to commerce. Our culture is fueled by our values of collaboration, decisiveness, urgency, willingness to change, and accountability.

–Diebold Nixdorf is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.


To all recruitment agencies: Diebold Nixdorf does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Diebold Nixdorf employees or any other organization location. Diebold Nixdorf is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes**


We are a global Company operating in multiple Locations and Entities. As we are keen to find the best solution for our candidates several legal entities might be applicable for a Job offer. A List of our operating entities can be found here - https://www.dieboldnixdorf.com/en-us/about-us/global-locations
